item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 13, 2024 at 2:40 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Notes on OpenAI's new o1 chain-of-thought models (94 points | 50 comments)
2. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (203 points | 33 comments)
3. FDA Authorizes First Over-the-Counter Hearing Aid Software (52 points | 19 comments)
4. The Strange Case of the Rogue HP-12c Calculator (35 points | 7 comments)
5. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1448 points | 1100 comments)
6. Breaking Down OnlyFans' Economics (74 points | 44 comments)
7. Notepat • Aesthetic Computer (26 points | 5 comments)
8. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (47 points | 17 comments)
9. Imbue (Formerly Generally Intelligent) (YC S17) Is Hiring Software Engineers ( | hide)
10. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (690 points | 335 comments)
11. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (152 points | 83 comments)
12. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (64 points | 15 comments)
13. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (221 points | 67 comments)
14. Understanding Concurrency, Parallelism and JavaScript (4 points | 1 comment)
15. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (42 points | 3 comments)
16. Why Haskell? (324 points | 415 comments)
17. If I could dissect a sauropod (109 points | 16 comments)
18. Some pterosaurs would flap, others would soar (8 points | discuss)
19. Advertising platform The Trade Desk is building its own smart TV OS (6 points | 3 comments)
20. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (49 points | 11 comments)
21. Greenland landslide caused freak wave that shook Earth for nine days (22 points | 2 comments)
22. DEF Con 32 – AMD Sinkclose Universal Ring-2 Privilege Escalation (Not Redacted) [pdf] (190 points | 29 comments)
23. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (70 points | 2 comments)
24. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (96 points | 54 comments)
25. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (62 points | 18 comments)
26. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (48 points | 5 comments)
27. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (62 points | 6 comments)
28. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (51 points | 26 comments)
29. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1542 points | 346 comments)
30. Ask HN: Should I open source my licensing server? (15 points | 17 comments)
